view.common

Class View

  • java.lang.Object
    • view.common.View
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AttackView, CardExchangeView, EditorMenuView, EditView, FortificationView, MainMenuView, MapEditorView, MapSelectionView, MapView, PhaseView, ReinforcementView, StartUpView, WorldDominationView

    public abstract class View
extends java.lang.Object
    The class is to show the inputed integers for the user and check the input integer is correct to the program or not.
    Author:
    Yann Kerichard, Yueshuai Jiang, Che-Shao Chen

    • Method Detail

      • getInteger

        protected int getInteger()
        The method to get the input integer. It also checks the input integer is correct or not. It is not correct, it will print a notice message to the user.
        Returns:
        Returning the next step texts if there are texts.

      • getString

        protected java.lang.String getString()
        The method to get the input string
        Returns:
        Returning input string if there are none or only space in the input

      • isValueCorrect

        protected boolean isValueCorrect(int value,
                                 int minimum,
                                 int maximum)
        The method is to check whether the input value is in the correct range.
        Parameters:
        value - The value of the input
        minimum - The minimum acceptable input value
        maximum - The maximum acceptable input value
        Returns:
        Returning false if the value id not in the range, otherwise returning true
